intro: Rhytidostemma badilloi, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and milky sap-producing species. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture. Rhytidostemma badilloi is primarily found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing in rocky or sandy soils.
